Convert a character vector into markdown paragraph(s)

Source: R/as-paragraph-md.R
as_paragraph_md.Rd

Parse markdown cells and returns the "paragraph" object.

as_paragraph_md(
  x,
  auto_color_link = "blue",
  .from = "markdown+autolink_bare_uris"
)

Arguments

x

A character vector.
auto_color_link

A color of the link texts.
.from

Pandoc's --from argument (default: 'markdown+autolink_bare_uris').

Examples

if (rmarkdown::pandoc_available()) {
  library(flextable)
  ft <- flextable(
    data.frame(
      x = c("**foo** bar", "***baz***", "*qux*"),
      stringsAsFactors = FALSE
    )
  )
  ft <- compose(ft, j = "x", i = 1:2, value = as_paragraph_md(x))
  autofit(ft)
}
#> a flextable object.
#> col_keys: `x` 
#> header has 1 row(s) 
#> body has 3 row(s) 
#> original dataset sample: 
#> [1] "**foo** bar" "***baz***"   "*qux*"
